title: Smite should be automatically selected when jungling
body:
Playing with people who "forgot smite" cause unnecessary losses.  You can't even report them because what category would you choose?  And ok, lets say it was a mistake, why should I automatically lose because  of it?

Runes have a auto-switching mechanic when the rune is incompatible with a champion.  It wouldn't be too hard to auto switch one Summoner Spell with smite for people who fill the role as jungle.

This isn't controversial, and can only lend to a more positive experience.

edit:  If I ran smiteless jg in ranked and was lvl 2 while rest game was lvl 6, would this not cause suspicion of trolling?  auto-selecting smite for those who get rolled JUNGLE helps curb this autoloss

I see enough of smiteless jungles to warrant me to ask for autoselecting a smite summoner spell.

No offence to all design suggestions but they do show what you what, but take in mind that we do have unsealed spellbook.

What that tells us is that riot has the ability to swap summoner spells within game.

My suggestion is to have a store purchase that is limited to before 3:00 (remake time) to swap out any summomer spell that has not been used.

Upon attempting a purchase a UI button of the summoner spell chosen appears above your viable to swap summoner spells (much like Kai'sa evolve), when leaving the fountain this UI disappears in the case of a misclick purchase (the same way you're unable to undo when leaving the fountain).
I support this idea 100%

Or, how about this? Instead of a minutes-long (and nearly useless) loading screen, allow selection of summoner spells and runes (which have always and still frequently glitch--as in, malfunction completely, rather than revert to a previous state--if you haven't finished editing them before the loading screen pops).

You might object: _"But what about the loading screen? The loading screen [of almost random duration, depending on network] gives players time to <x>, <y>, and <z>. If you don't see the enemy team's summoner spells &c., how will anyone <1>, <2>, or <3>?"_

The loading screen frequently lasts as long as champion select, and it's not as if all information has to be displayed at the same time. And considering that the pre-game _champion and role negotiation_ is definitively concluded when the loading screen pops up (champions all locked, etc.), there is plenty of time for these two things:

- A limited re-selection of summoner spells (and maybe confirming runes) within a given time period

- Revealing the teams' summoner spells/capstone selections to one another in time to allow <1>, <2>, <3>, and then some.

---

On paper, there are so many reasonable ways to smooth this rough edge in the software that I refuse to believe that none are practical. (Naturally, I have no way of knowing for certain; faith is my only option, absent privileged information).

The reason it doesn't exist is because of players who switch positions in champion select.

 Forcefully to giving a player a summoner spell is just another way Riot would be simplifying the game. The game doesn't start when the timer does, it starts in champion select,  and neglecting to do certain things is the fault of the player. 

The only way this would work would be if there was an option to actually trade roles in champion select. (Like how we trade champions).

It think shouldn't auto-switch upon starting the game. I think it should rather auto-switch your non-flash summoner upon being placed in the Lobby. You could change it back anytime, but that would help a lot against unwanted mistakes.
